AuxiliaryDetails.description: Auxiliary details of the associated Nym Node.

accepted_operator_terms_and_conditions.description:
Specifies whether this node operator has agreed to the terms and conditions
as defined at <https://nymtech.net/terms-and-conditions/operators/v1.0.0>

location.description: Optional ISO 3166 alpha-2 two-letter country code of the node's **physical** location

binary_name.description: Provides the name of the binary, i.e. the content of `CARGO_PKG_NAME` environmental variable.

build_timestamp.description: Provides the build timestamp, for example `2021-02-23T20:14:46.558472672+00:00`.

build_version.description: Provides the build version, for example `0.1.0-9-g46f83e1`.

cargo_profile.description: Provides the cargo debug mode that was used for the build.

cargo_triple.description: Provides the cargo target triple that was used for the build.

commit_branch.description: Provides the name of the git branch that was used for the build, for example `master`.

commit_sha.description: Provides the hash of the commit that was used for the build, for example `46f83e112520533338245862d366f6a02cef07d4`.

commit_timestamp.description: Provides the timestamp of the commit that was used for the build, for example `2021-02-23T08:08:02-05:00`.

rustc_channel.description: Provides the rustc channel that was used for the build, for example `nightly`.

rustc_version.description: Provides the rustc version that was used for the build, for example `1.52.0-nightly`.

deposit_id.description: the id of the associated deposit

signature.description: Signature on the inner sign request and the tx hash

score.description: Total score after taking all the criteria into consideration

build_timestamp.description: Provides the build timestamp, for example `2021-02-23T20:14:46.558472672+00:00`.

build_version.description: Provides the build version, for example `0.1.0-9-g46f83e1`.

cargo_debug.description: Provides the cargo debug mode that was used for the build.

cargo_opt_level.description: Provides the opt value set by cargo during the build

commit_branch.description: Provides the name of the git branch that was used for the build, for example `master`.

commit_sha.description: Provides the hash of the commit that was used for the build, for example `46f83e112520533338245862d366f6a02cef07d4`.

commit_timestamp.description: Provides the timestamp of the commit that was used for the build, for example `2021-02-23T08:08:02-05:00`.

contract_name.description: Provides the name of the binary, i.e. the content of `CARGO_PKG_NAME` environmental variable.

rustc_version.description: Provides the rustc version that was used for the build, for example `1.52.0-nightly`.

contract.description:
contract is the crate name of the implementing contract, eg. `crate:cw20-base`
we will use other prefixes for other languages, and their standard global namespacing

version.description:
version is any string that this implementation knows. It may be simple counter "1", "2".
or semantic version on release tags "v0.7.0", or some custom feature flag list.
the only code that needs to understand the version parsing is code that knows how to
migrate from the given contract (and is tied to it's implementation somehow)

EcashTicketVerificationResult.description: Used exclusively as part of OpenAPI docs

current_epoch_id.description: Monotonously increasing id of the current epoch in this interval.

current_epoch_start.description: The timestamp indicating the start of the current rewarding epoch.

epoch_length.description: The duration of all epochs in this interval.

epochs_in_interval.description: Number of epochs in this interval.

id.description: Monotonously increasing id of this interval.

total_elapsed_epochs.description: The total amount of elapsed epochs since the first epoch of the first interval.

IntervalRewardParams.description: Parameters required by the mix-mining reward distribution that do not change during an interval.

active_set_work_factor.description:
Current active set work factor.
It is not really expected to be changing very often.
As a matter of fact, unless there's a very specific reason, it should remain constant.

epoch_reward_budget.description:
Current value of the computed reward budget per epoch, per node.
It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

interval_pool_emission.description:
Current maximum interval pool emission.
Assuming all nodes in the rewarded set are fully saturated and have 100% performance,
this % of the reward pool would get distributed in rewards to all operators and its delegators.
It is not really expected to be changing very often.
As a matter of fact, unless there's a very specific reason, it should remain constant.

reward_pool.description:
Current value of the rewarding pool.
It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

stake_saturation_point.description:
Current value of the stake saturation point.
It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

staking_supply.description:
Current value of the staking supply.
It is expected to be constant throughout the interval.

staking_supply_scale_factor.description:
Defines the percentage of stake needed to reach saturation for all of the nodes in the rewarded set.
Also known as `beta`.

sybil_resistance.description:
Current value of the sybil resistance percent (`alpha`).
It is not really expected to be changing very often.
As a matter of fact, unless there's a very specific reason, it should remain constant.

address.description: address of the embedded ip packet router

bond_information.description: Basic bond information of this mixnode, such as owner address, original pledge, etc.

pending_changes.description: Adjustments to the mixnode that are ought to happen during future epoch transitions.

rewarding_details.description: Details used for computation of rewarding related data.

address.description: address of the embedded network requester

uses_exit_policy.description: flag indicating whether this network requester uses the exit policy rather than the deprecated allow list

entry_gateways.description: The expected number of nodes assigned entry gateway role (i.e. [`Role::EntryGateway`])

exit_gateways.description: The expected number of nodes assigned exit gateway role (i.e. [`Role::ExitGateway`])

mixnodes.description: The expected number of nodes assigned the 'mixnode' role, i.e. total of [`Role::Layer1`], [`Role::Layer2`] and [`Role::Layer3`].

standby.description: Number of nodes in the 'standby' set. (i.e. [`Role::Standby`])

score.description: Total score after taking all the criteria into consideration

performance.description: Average node performance in last 24h period

gateway_cosmos_addr.description: Cosmos address of the sender of the credential

proposal_id.description: Multisig proposal for releasing funds for the provided bandwidth credential

credential.description: The cryptographic material required for spending the underlying credential.

gateway_cosmos_addr.description: Cosmos address of the sender of the credential

WithdrawalRequest.description:
Represents a withdrawal request generate by the client who wants to obtain a zk-nym credential.

This struct encapsulates the necessary components for a withdrawal request, including the joined commitment hash, the joined commitment,
individual Pedersen commitments for private attributes, and a zero-knowledge proof for the withdrawal request.

# Fields

* `joined_commitment_hash` - The joined commitment hash represented as a G1Projective element.
* `joined_commitment` - The joined commitment represented as a G1Projective element.
* `private_attributes_commitments` - A vector of individual Pedersen commitments for private attributes represented as G1Projective elements.
* `zk_proof` - The zero-knowledge proof for the withdrawal request.

# Derives

The struct derives `Debug` and `PartialEq` to provide debug output and basic comparison functionality.
